meanings.definition: The process of becoming middle-class in values, habits, and aspirations.
meanings.sent1: Her embourgeoisement was evident in her newfound appreciation for fine dining.
meanings.sent2: The embourgeoisement of the neighborhood led to the opening of upscale boutiques.
meanings.sent3: His embourgeoisement was so sudden that he started carrying a designer handbag to work.
meanings.sent4: The embourgeoisement of his taste in music surprised his friends.
meanings.sent5: The embourgeoisement of the town transformed it into a hub of cultural events.

meanings.definition: The act of adopting the lifestyle or values of the bourgeoisie.
meanings.sent1: Their embourgeoisement was evident in their preference for luxury vacations.
meanings.sent2: The embourgeoisement of the young artist was reflected in his choice of expensive art supplies.
meanings.sent3: The cat's embourgeoisement was clear when it refused to eat anything but gourmet cat food.
meanings.sent4: Her embourgeoisement was like stepping into a different world of sophistication.
meanings.sent5: The embourgeoisement of his speech patterns made him sound like a member of high society.
